original_solution_mapping.L1: Each 4 by 4 square equals 16 square inches because 4 x 4 = <<4*4=16>>16
original_solution_mapping.L2: Three squares equals 48 square inches because 3 x 16 = <<48=48>>48
original_solution_mapping.L3: Each rectangle uses 12 square inches because 2 x 6 = <<2*6=12>>12
original_solution_mapping.L4: Both rectangles will use 24 square inches because 2 x 12 = <<2*12=24>>24
original_solution_mapping.L5: He has 1/2 of the ink left because 24 / 48 = 1/2
original_solution_mapping.L6: He has 50% of the ink left because 1/2 x 100 = <<1/2*100=50>>50

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6716.
    Returns: the percentage of ink left in the marker.
    """
    # L1
    square_side_length = 4 # 4 inch by 4 inch squares
    square_area = square_side_length * square_side_length

    # L2
    num_squares = 3 # three 4 inch by 4 inch squares
    total_ink_capacity = num_squares * square_area

    # L3
    rectangle_width = 6 # 6 inch by 2 inch rectangles
    rectangle_height = 2 # 6 inch by 2 inch rectangles
    rectangle_area = rectangle_width * rectangle_height

    # L4
    num_rectangles = 2 # two 6 inch by 2 inch rectangles
    total_ink_used = num_rectangles * rectangle_area

    # L5
    fraction_ink_left = total_ink_used / total_ink_capacity

    # L6
    percentage_multiplier = 100 # WK
    percentage_ink_left = fraction_ink_left * percentage_multiplier

    # FA
    answer = percentage_ink_left
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Each {square_side_length} by {square_side_length} square equals {square_area} square inches because {square_side_length} x {square_side_length} = <<{square_side_length}*{square_side_length}={square_area}>>{square_area}
Three squares equals {total_ink_capacity} square inches because {num_squares} x {square_area} = <<{total_ink_capacity}={total_ink_capacity}>>{total_ink_capacity}
Each rectangle uses {rectangle_area} square inches because {rectangle_height} x {rectangle_width} = <<{rectangle_height}*{rectangle_width}={rectangle_area}>>{rectangle_area}
Both rectangles will use {total_ink_used} square inches because {num_rectangles} x {rectangle_area} = <<{num_rectangles}*{rectangle_area}={total_ink_used}>>{total_ink_used}
He has {fraction_ink_left} of the ink left because {total_ink_used} / {total_ink_capacity} = {fraction_ink_left}
He has {percentage_ink_left}% of the ink left because {fraction_ink_left} x {percentage_multiplier} = <<{fraction_ink_left}*{percentage_multiplier}={percentage_ink_left}>>{percentage_ink_left}

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: Both rectangles will use 576 square inches because 48 x 12 = <<48*12=576>>576
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L5: He has 12 of the ink left because 576 / 48 = 12
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L6: He has 1200% of the ink left because 12 x 100 = <<12*100=1200>>1200

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'total_ink_capacity' (48) was used instead of 'num_rectangles' (2).
